utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And the next wedding gift is a gravy boat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, one gravy boat.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s from Sheldon. He told me he had it engraved.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: In the event of a divorce, please return to Sheldon Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: One inappropriate, yet I wish I thought of that gravy boat.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: When I get married I’m going to register at the UCLA Cadaver Lab.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ew, why?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: ‘Cause I’ve always wanted a whole human skeleton and they are really spendy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, you actually see you and Sheldon getting married someday?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Not just someday. In exactly four years. But don’t tell Sheldon. He’s still a flight risk.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What about you, Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What about me what?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do you think you and Leonard might ever get married?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, well, you know, Leonard is great.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: But do you think you’ll ever get married?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He’s a sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re not answering the question. Do you love him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, sure, of course I love him.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It doesn’t sound like it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I do.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do you tell him that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, he’d just take it the wrong way.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It means he is special and smart and nice and…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you gonna break up with him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Maybe. I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I had no idea you were unhappy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s the thing, I’m not. I’m not unhappy at all. It’s just, I don’t know, I, I’ve been in love before, but it felt different. But maybe this is a new, better, boring kind of love. Do you ever feel that way about Howard?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, that’s not really a fair comparison. I’m basically married to a sexy Buzz Lightyear.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Amy, you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Can’t help ya, kid. Whenever I’m around Sheldon, I feel like my loins are on fire. In the good way. Not the urinary tract infection way.

utterance.speaker: Raj (voice off)
utterance.content: Hey, buddy, how’s it going up there?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You don’t have to shout, Raj. It’s not like I’m an astronaut floating around in outer space. Oh, wait, I am.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, is it everything you hoped it would be?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s better. I wake up every morning and I just can’t believe I’m on this incredible adventure.

utterance.speaker: Dimitri
utterance.content: Hey, Froot Loops, did you clean the space toilet?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Excuse me. I’m talking to my friends.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You know the rules, new guy scrubs the toilet.

utterance.speaker: Dimitri
utterance.content: If you do good job, next time we give you brush.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Funny. We’re always giving each other a hard time up here. It’s kind of like being in a frat. You know, joking, kidding around, hurting feelings.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, my turn. Let me talk to him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: 2311 North Los Robles Avenue, Pasadena, California to International Space Station. Can you read me? Over.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, I read you, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Copy that. Over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am talking to a man in space. If you don’t have the then he might as well be at the Coffee Bean over on Lake Street.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re out of your mind,Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a negative. My mother had me tested. Over.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Come on, scrub it up, Loops.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, all right. I gotta go. There’s a meteor shower.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You want to see a meteor shower? Take a look at what Dimitri just left you in the toilet.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Over and out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Bye, buddy!

utterance.speaker: Stuart (knocking and entering)
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, Stuart, come on in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Um, Raj invited me to go to the movies with you guys.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. I didn’t authorize this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you are not in charge.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s mighty sassy for a man with a roommate performance review around the corner.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What’s the big deal? You guys are bringing your girlfriends. I didn’t want to sit by myself.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The big deal is I was expecting us to be an intimate group of five. Now, we’re going to be a faceless mass of six.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’ll be fine. Just, uh, pretend he’s Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm. Do you like Raisinets?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I can take them or leave them.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: At the movies, Wolowitz always eats Raisinets.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Would you feel more comfortable if I ate Raisinets?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it’s hardly my business what you eat, as long as it doesn’t crunch during the film and it’s Raisinets.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay. Should we go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yuh-uh, one more question, if you’re going to replace Wolowitz, I need to know a little more about you.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wolowitz went to MIT. What’s your educational background?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I went to art school.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Equally ridiculous. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This insistence on hand-holding is preposterous.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I like it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, of course you do. You’re a girl. You like all kinds of hippy-dippy things.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Just watch the movie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not fair. Penny isn’t making Leonard hold hands.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: There might be a reason for that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sweaty? Unhygienic? Looks dumb? Take your pick.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Penny said she’s not sure she wants to be Leonard’s girlfriend anymore.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wrong. She just took a sip from his Diet Dr. Pepper.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, if she wants to end her pair-bond with Leonard, why on earth would she guzzle a witches’ brew of his soda and spit?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s complicated.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: String theory is complicated. That’s just yucky. Don’t get any ideas. All right, for the sake of argument, let’s say that’s true. Why doesn’t Penny just end the relationship?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She’s not sure how she feels.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How can she not be sure how she feels? You know, when I have a feeling, I know it. Trains? Love them. Swordfish? I love them, too. They’re fish with a sword for a nose.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Regardless, don’t say anything to Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now you’re asking me to keep a secret from my best friend, colleague, and roommate?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, please, Penny will kill me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, fine. FYI, secret-keeping? Hate it. Hand-holding? Not a fan. Hammerhead shark? I love that thing. Yeah, it’s another fish with a tool on its head.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Raisinet?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Shh, we’re trying to watch the movie. This is not working out with him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think I might have tartar buildup. My tongue won’t go as far forward as it used to.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe your tongue is shrinking.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (measures)
utterance.content: Nope. Oh, you have no idea how annoying this is.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m starting to get a sense of it. Don’t worry. I’ll take you to the dentist tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. I appreciate that. You’re good people, Leonard. There’s something I need to tell you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t tell you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t tell you why I can’t tell you. So I guess there’s two things I can’t tell you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wish there were more.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good night. I’m sorry. This is really important.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I like The Transformers. Do you like The Transformers?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where exactly did your mother have you tested?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, the Transformers teach us that things are not always what they appear to be. You know, like, uh, a semi truck might be an alien robot, or, uh, someone in a romantic relationship, uh, might feel differently than they appear to. Or a conversation about The Transformers might actually be about someone in this room. I’m going to pause to let that sink in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I think I understand.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The guy who seems like an emotionless robot is you, but your relationship with Amy is causing you to transform into a red-blooded man with sexual desires.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is literally the stupidest thing I’ve ever heard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard? Leonard? Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sleeping?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was. Now I’m having a nightmare. What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Never mind. I still can’t tell you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny? Penny? Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You frightened me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you doing in my bedroom?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I knocked on the front door, but you didn’t hear it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How did you even get in, you weirdo?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, really? I’ve seen strange men traipsing in and out of here for years, but when I do it, it’s weird?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you want, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I was having a little trouble sleeping and I just thought, uh, seeing as you’re up, we could talk.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Talk about what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know, uh, weather, uh, fish you could do carpentry with, why Leonard is such an attractive and desirable boyfriend. Yeah, pick one, your choice.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you know that Leonard has a perfect driving record and enjoys the insurance discounts that go along with that? Hubba-hubba.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, go home, crazy man.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah. Did you know that while Leonard is not considered a tall fellow in our country, in today’s North Korea, he’s downright average. Hey, talk about a keeper.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, what did Amy tell you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, very well. I can’t keep up this clever charade any longer. She told me that you were thinking of ending it with Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, you listen to me. I think it’s really sweet you’re trying to protect your friend, but this is none of your business. Got it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. This is not about protecting my friend. I’m a big fan of homeostasis. Do you know what that is?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course not.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Homeostasis refers to a system’s ability to regulate its internal environment and maintain a constant condition of properties like temperature or pH.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Worst bedtime story ever.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My point is I don’t like when things change. So, regardless of your feelings, I would like you to continue dating Leonard. And also, while we’re on the subject, you recently changed your shampoo. I’m not comfortable with the new scent. Please stop this madness and go back to green apple.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, honey, I have a lot to figure out, and until I do, you are not to say a word to Leonard. Do you understand?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I do. You clear on the shampoo issue?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please don’t hurt my friend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That is the last thing I want to do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Coconut? What were you thinking? Are you a hula girl?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What the hell is wrong with you? You told Sheldon? Do you know what a terrible position this puts me in?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hang on, please. Hello?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, just a heads-up: Penny knows that you blabbed about Leonard. She’s pretty mad.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I know. She’s yelling at me right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right then, so we’re all on the same page. Yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Bernie.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: There’s my hubby. How’s everything going up there?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, it’s okay. Space is beautiful. Earth is beautiful. Same old, same old.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nothing. Everything’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The other astronauts are being mean to me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, what are they doing?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, like for instance, the other day when I was asleep, one of the guys went on a space walk and glued a big-eyed rubber alien mask to the outside of my window. When I woke up, I screamed for like nine minutes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, Howie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You can see it if you want. It’s on YouTube. Google astronaut screams for nine minutes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why don’t you stand up to them?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What am I supposed to say?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know. Say, being mean is lame, what’s cool is being nice.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great, I’ll do that when I want to be the first guy in space to get a wedgie.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do you want me to call somebody at NASA?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. My mom already tried that. It only made things worse.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Gelatinous Sphere.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Focused Locust.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Temple of Yip.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Wolowitz would never play that card.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: All right, Lesser Demon Turtle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fairy God Monster, I win. Your desperate need for friendship makes you weak.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, what are you guys doing later? Stuart and I were thinking of going out for a drink.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: We’re gonna try to meet some girls.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: ‘Cause that’s what we do.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Watch out, ladies, a little coffee and cream coming your way.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: In case you didn’t follow that, I’m the coffee.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard? Maybe you’d like to go with them to meet girls.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would I be interested? I have Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, for now. But that woman has a death wish, Leonard. She talks to strangers, she pets unfamiliar dogs, and it is ridiculously easy to break into her apartment. If I were you, I’d get a back-up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You can’t just replace someone you care about with some other random person.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No, please don’t ruin this for me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you remember how upset I was when they replaced Edward Norton as the Hulk?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, you walked around for a week saying, Sheldon unhappy with casting choice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But, then Mark Ruffalo was the Hulk in The Avengers, and he was even better.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s your point?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Call me a romantic. I like to think that your Mark Ruffalo is still out there somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. Are we gonna play cards or not?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I like Mark Ruffalo, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, settle down there, fake Wolowitz. No one likes a kiss-up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, I had to take Sheldon to the dentist this morning.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yup. I told him if he didn’t bite the hygienist, I’d take him for ice cream.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t have to take him for ice cream.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You okay? You seem a little distracted.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, there’s something I need to tell you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Yeah, okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t really know how to say this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just say it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Here goes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You slept with him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I didn’t know what else to do. He had those big, sad eyes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, sure, you had no choice.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He looked at me like this.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, if that’s all it takes, it’s a good thing you don’t have a dog.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t worry. You’ll have plenty of chances to break up with him. Your wedding day, your honeymoon, your 50th anniversary.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, it’s fine. We’re not getting married, okay? We’re keeping things, you know, homeostasis.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s so cute when she tries.

utterance.speaker: Penny (phone text tone)
utterance.content: It’s from Leonard. Last night was amazing. You’re amazing. I’m so lucky to have you in my life. Okay, stop it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Bernie, guess what? I stood up to the other astronauts like you said and I got to tell you, last night was the first time in a week I got a good night’s sleep.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, Howie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s wrong? You look upset.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Nope, this is my proud face.
